newsitem.title: INDONESIA: Garuda Indonesia launches cargo service.
newsitem.headline: Garuda Indonesia launches cargo service.

text.p: Indonesia's national airline Garuda has launched its first cargo aircraft in a bid to compete with other carriers in the region, news reports said on Monday.

Syahrul Tahir, vice president of cargo planning and development, was quoted by the Jakarta Post newspaper as saying after the launch on Sunday that the Boeing 737-200C will serve major cities in eastern Indonesia including the country's second city Surabaya.
"We are not behind in this business," Syahrul said, referring to other Southeast Asian national carriers already operating in the region.
"We plan to also add some regional destinations such as Kuala Lumpur," Syahrul was quoted as saying, adding that Garuda will launch a second plane in early November.
The second plane will serve routes in western Indonesia, including Batam Island, 20 km south of Singapore, the official Antara news agency reported.
Earlier this year Indonesia moved to protect domestic cargo carriers by limiting foreign operators to Hang Nadim airport on Batam Island.

The Indonesian government has said it wants to develop Batam into an international cargo hub and earlier this year reported that it had entered into negotiations with German flag carrier Lufthansa to service Europe from the island.
